voting under way as polls open in general election .
security boost pledge for lincolnshire show .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's the live coverage from our lincolnshire newsroom today , but before we wrap up , here are a few things we did n't know this morning :
that 's it from me- have a good evening !
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : here 's peter with tonight 's look north headlines
text: tonight 's headlines with @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: north lincs park up for a top award
text: central park in scunthorpe is in the running for a prestigious award .
earlier this week judges from the keep britain tidy group descended on the town to see if the park would be given green flag status .
central park in scunthorpe will have to wait until next month to hear if its been awarded green flag status .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: weather : more rain is on it 's way
text: any lingering showers this evening will ease , with clear spells developing .
however , further showers will start to push in from the west through the second half of the night .
winds will ease slightly though .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: tour of britain route updated
text: the route for the tour of britain cycling race in north lincolnshire has been updated .
north lincolnshire council says stage three of the national event will take place in the area on tuesday 5 september , covering 172 km of the local countryside .
the race will start at normanby hall country park and will cover the isle of axholme , brigg and barton , before the big finish near central park in scunthorpe .

documents.title: weather puts the brakes on any isle of man tt action
text: there 's been no chance of action today for our lincolnshire riders at the isle of man tt .
the supersport race has been cancelled because of bad weather and wo n't be rearranged as there 's not enough time to fit it in .
louth 's peter hickman had hoped to add a fifth podium place to his tally .
here 's the updated schedule for tomorrow 's racing :
new schedule for tomorrow # iomtt # iomtt2017 ( friday )
road closure is as per original schedule , senior is always earlier than other race days .
catches people out though !
fingers crossed the weather comes good
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: warning issued over bogus callers
text: anglian water are warning you to be vigilant against bogus callers .
they say they 've had a number of uniforms stolen in neighbouring cambridgeshire .
they 're urging residents to always check id when answering the door .
we want all of our customers to feel safe in their own home which is why it 's important they know what to expect from a real anglian water employee . ''
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'waste not , want not ! '
text: a new cafe is opening in lincoln with the aim of reducing food waste .
mint lane cafe will serve food from supermarkets that 's too old to sell but has n't exceeded its 'use by date ' .
i 've sampled some of their dishes and they 're very tasty !
my lunch today - food that would have been going in the bin - # mintlanecafe in lincoln are making it into delicious meals @ twitterid
looks good .
i 'd eat it .
winning !
author: Caroline Bilton
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : sunshine and showers
text: staying mostly cloudy and wet this afternoon with the odd sunny spell- feeling cool too under the cloud in the brisk winds .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingman jailed for possessing thousands of indecent images
text: a lincolnshire man who had more than 80,000 indecent images of children has been jailed for four years .
gary davison , of hunt lea avenue in lincoln , admitted three charges at lincoln crown court .
the national crime agency raided the 56-year-old 's home .
officers found so much material it took a year to complete the investigation .
there were so many images that the police were overwhelmed . ''
davison was also placed on the sex offenders ' register for life and given an indefinite sexual harm prevention order intended to control his behaviour after he is released from his prison sentence .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire school taken over by academies trust
text: an academies trust is taking over a fifth school in lincolnshire .
the cherry willingham community school ( cwcs ) is joining the priory federation of academies trust .
it is expected that cwcs will officially join the trust in september , subject to final department for education approval after the general election .

a senior team from the priory will be working with cwcs headteacher elaine stiles , as well as with staff and students , before and during the summer holiday in order to have all the necessary plans in place for the new academic year .
there will be meetings over the next few weeks with governors , parents , staff and students to ensure that we communicate fully with everyone involved . ''
ling moor primary academy , in north hykeham and belvoir high school in bottesford , near grantham could also join the trust in the autumn .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: drugs gang jailed
text: a drugs gang who imported mephedrone from china to sell on the streets of boston have been jailed .
the gang leader donatas liumus from peterborough will serve 11 years .
lincoln crown court heard that liumus sourced the drugs - known as mcat- directly from the manufacturer .
a consignment of 24 kilos was delivered through courier companies .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: sincil bank brick by brick !
text: a lego superfan has built lincoln city 's sincil bank stadium out of the famous plastic bricks .
chris smith from altrincham is attempting to build all 92 premier league and football league stadiums out of lego .
it 's reportedly taken between 750 and 1,000 bricks to complete the sincil bank stadium that 's a lot of bricks !
meeting @ twitterid who 's delivering his @ twitterid @ twitterid sincil bank stadium today to @ twitterid
by coincidence @ twitterid the team arrived @ twitterid today !
love how i am not happy lego man
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid looks pretty impressive rob .
that is impressive !
nice work .
looking forward to next season over here in the u.s. !
# uti # teamlincoln # upthemightyimps # americanimp
want one
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: young lincolnshire actor to star in the new series of poldark
text: a young lincolnshire actor will be seen by millions this weekend .
harry marcus from lincoln is in the new series of poldark which starts on sunday .
the 13-year-old plays captain poldark 's nephew .
poldark is back on bbc one this sunday night at 21:00 .
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: e-fit appeal over lincoln sexual assault
text: police have released an e-fit of a man they want to talk to about a sexual assault in lincoln .
officers say a woman in her late teens was attacked in st benedict 's square off the high street at about 04:00 on saturday 20 may .
the man 's described as being in his early 20s , of slim build and with short ginger hair .
anyone with information about the attack is being asked to get in touch with police .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire rider looks for fifth tt podium place
text: louth 's peter hickman is going for his fifth podium finish of this year 's isle of man tt today in the second supersport race of the week .
hickman took his tally to four yesterday with second place in the superstock race and third in the lightweight race .
bardney 's ivan lintin , who was fourth in the lightweight race , and david hewson are our other local riders in action .
author: Su Whitaker
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our bbc lincoln newsroom this lunchtime :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: security boost pledge for lincolnshire show
text: extra security will be in place for this year 's lincolnshire show , it 's been confirmed .
the two-day event gets under way a fortnight today at th 200-acre showground at grange de lings near lincoln .
chief executive jane southall says while there 's `` no evidence '' to suggest the show is at risk , precautions are being taken in the light of recent events in london and manchester :
`` we will have a police presence at the show , we 've introduced more cctv cameras across the showground , '' she says .
`` we also have our own security company that we contract for the lincolnshire show and there will be the possibility that we will do searches and so on . ''

documents.title: visitors flock to lincoln to see domesday book
text: more than 10,000 people have been to see the domesday book since it went on display at lincoln castle last month .
it 's the first time the book , which documents medieval britain , has ever gone on display outside of london .
it 's on loan from its permanent home at the national archives .

the domesday book , which contains two million words , was commissioned in december 1085 by norman king william the conqueror after his invasion of england and lists the taxable value of his new kingdom .
it is on show alongside lincoln 's original copy of magna carta , a document outlining basic rights which was signed by king john in 1215 .

documents.title: man dies after getting trapped between car and garage door
text: a 72-year-old man has died after becoming trapped between a car and a garage door in belton , north lincolnshire .
the emergency services were called to a property on westgate road at about 12:20 on wednesday afternoon .
the man , who has n't been named by police , was pronounced dead at the scene .
police are asking anyone who saw what happened to get in touch .

documents.title: watch : lincolnshire music charity looks to hit the right note
text: if you fancy taking up a musical instrument in later life , a lincolnshire music charity wants to hear from you .
soundlincs has managed to secure money from the arts council and postcode lottery to run older adult music and singing groups across the county .
at the moment six are up and running - but the charity 's looking to set up more .
here 's just a little taster of what they get up to :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: oh deer ! fire fighters rescue trapped animal
text: seems like it 's already been a busy day for emergency crews in sleaford :
08:18 - sleaford used hydraulic spreaders to release a muntjac deer that was stuck in railings on mareham lane , sleaford .
hi - was the deer unhurt ?
did you release it straight away ?
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: have you seen this stolen motorbike ?
text: this motorbike - a yellow yamaha r125 - was stolen from a garden in danube square , spalding , sometime overnight between 23 and 24 may .
anyone with information about its whereabouts is being asked to contact pc ben harrington by calling 101 :
this motorbike was stolen from a property in spalding on 24th may .
have you seen it ?
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : lincolnshire 's thursday forecast
text: patchy rain around gainsborough will gradually spread further south and east and then die out .
skies will brighten up later , bringing some dry sunny spells in the afternoon .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the top stories from across lincolnshire so far this morning include :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: it 's the clash of the castles !
text: lincoln castle has been shortlisted in a poll to find out if it 's the uk 's favourite .
the 11th century stronghold , which was built by william the conqueror , is up against the likes of bamburgh castle , edinburgh castle and durham castle in the poll .
the domesday book recently went on public display at the castle as part of a summer exhibition .
it 's on loan from its permanent home at the national archives in london until september .
you have until 20 june to vote for your favourite .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: voting 's under way across lincolnshire
text: millions of people across the uk are casting their votes today in the general election .
polling stations opened at 07:00 and will close at 22 : 00 .
the first results will come before midnight , with the vast majority of constituencies declaring in the early hours of tomorrow morning .
police say there 'll be increased security at polling stations - including patrols by armed officers in some areas - following the recent terror attacks .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: today 's weather forecast for lincolnshire
text: a cloudy start with outbreaks of rain which may be heavy at times .
this will clear later allowing some brighter spells but heavy showers following .
feeling cool under the cloud in the brisk winds .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
it 's lizzie with you today and i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , weather , sport and travel from across the county .
if you want to get in touch please do .
just send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire
